Pregnancy, non-obstetric surgery

Pregnancy, non-obstetric surgery Main problems are:

- Teratogenicity (main concern in 1 st trimester)

- Premature labour (main concern in 2 nd trimester), may be precipitated by surgery but this is unusual with the exception of cervical xxx

- Foetal hypoxia (main concern in late pregnancy). Ion trapping of opiates in the foetus is a concern immediately before birth.

(See placenta )
